articles.author: Meredith Cash
articles.title: Serena Williams wins US Open match, delays goodbye to tennis
articles.description: Serena Williams' 6-3, 6-3 win over Danka Kovinić in the first round of the US Open extends her illustrious tennis career just a little bit longer.
articles.content:
FLUSHING MEADOWS, NEW YORK  Serena's not done yet.
With a 6-3, 6-3 victory over World No. 80 Danka Kovini in the first round of her final US Open, Williams earned her first win at a Grand Slam in ov… [+2085 chars]

articles.author: Erin Snodgrass
articles.title: Man sets record after 40-mile river journey in massive pumpkin
articles.description: It took Duane Hansen of Syracuse, Nebraska, nearly a decade to grow the perfect gourd to break the world record for "longest journey by pumpkin boat."
articles.content:
A Nebraska man celebrated his 60th birthday last week by floating down the Missouri River in an 846-pound pumpkin named 'Berta' and likely setting a new world record in the process.
Duane Hansen gre… [+2097 chars]

articles.description: The actor appeared at the Video Music Awards via a pre-recorded clip where he appeared as the network's moon man statuette.
articles.content:
Amber Heard's sister Whitney Henriquez criticized MTV for including Johnny Depp at the Video Music Awards on Sunday.

articles.title: Microsoft startups boss accused of treating women unfairly is leaving
articles.description: Microsoft hired Jeff Ma to run its startups organization in 2020. His behavior led to an exodus of senior women leaders, Insider reported previously.
articles.content:

articles.title: Satellite images show damage to building at Ukrainian nuclear plant
articles.description: A nuclear watchdog agency said it's sending a mission to Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant this week to inspect its safety and security.
articles.content:
Satellite images published on Monday show local fires and damage to a building at southern Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, which occupying Russian troops have been using as a shield.

articles.author: Ed Zitron
articles.title: 'Quiet quitting' is what angry managers call employees setting healthy job limits
articles.description: Companies are freaking out over "quiet quitting." But employees aren't refusing to do their jobs — they're just setting healthy limits around work.
articles.content:
It's time to stop playing into this terrible "quiet quitting" craze.
